last_episode_to_air.name: The Long Offseason
last_episode_to_air.overview: Artificial intelligence threatens to take steps in its pursuit to rule the world and attempts to take over baseball. Jim and Jules must decide if they want to embolden this emerging society ruled by machines or stay with the failing status quo.

name: Brockmire
overview: A famed major league baseball announcer who suffers an embarrassing and very public meltdown live on the air after discovering his beloved wife's serial infidelity decides to reclaim his career and love life in a small town a decade later.

seasons.name: Season 2
seasons.overview: Now in New Orleans, Jim strives to break back out of the minors and back into the major leagues while continuing his popular podcast, facing a whole new level of drunken debauchery that The Big Easy makes so easy.

seasons.name: Season 3
seasons.overview: Season three takes place three months after his stint in rehab, with Brockmire doing play-by-play in the radio booth for the major leagues in central Florida during spring training while maintaining his brazen and narcissistic tendencies, despite actually being on the wagon. When an opportunity arises for Jim and his new co-host Gabby to take over as lead broadcasters in Oakland, he must fight to change his ever-present amorality.

seasons.name: Season 4
seasons.overview: The fourth and final season jumps ahead to a dystopian, climate-changed 2030 when Jim Brockmire — clean-and-sober but still eloquently nasty — is named commissioner of baseball.

episodes.name: Rally Cap
episodes.overview: After walking in on his wife in bed with the neighbor, famed MLB announcer Jim Brockmire has an epic job-ending meltdown live on the air. A decade later, he decides to reclaim his career calling minor league games in an unknown rust belt small town.

episodes.name: Winning Streak
episodes.overview: Jim and Jules hook up the night before the Frackers win a game. They attempt to keep the lucky streak going on and off the field. Meanwhile, Brockmire contemplates what Jules means to him.

episodes.name: Kangaroo Court
episodes.overview: The players hold an intense kangaroo court. Jules urges Brockmire to mediate. Meanwhile, Charles wonders why Brockmire thinks he is gay.

episodes.name: Retaliation
episodes.overview: Brockmire's ex-wife, Lucy, reappears. Forced to confront his emotions, Brockmire defaults to drinking. Things quickly spiral out of control when he finds a target for his anger.

episodes.name: Breakout Year
episodes.overview: Brockmire attempts fame again. Jules and Charles work to make him a household name. Their efforts pay off when he gains a very unexpected fan base.

episodes.name: Road Trip
episodes.overview: Brockmire and Jules have a pregnancy scare. Brockmire works out his father issues with Charles. Jules and Brockmire decide to take a road trip to Pittsburgh.

episodes.name: Old Timers Day
episodes.overview: Brockmire attends an event honoring broadcasters. Charles attempts to impress a young lady.

episodes.name: It All Comes Down to This
episodes.overview: Brockmire makes a decision. He must choose between staying in Morristown or returning to the major leagues.

episodes.name: The Getaway Game
episodes.overview: Now calling minor league games in New Orleans, Jim is up for the major leagues in Atlanta. He competes against Raj, a likable young announcer. Charles works on the podcast despite Brockmire's antics. A friend from Morristown stops by for a visit.

episodes.name: Platoon Player
episodes.overview: Despite Jim's protests, Charles needs the night off for his birthday. Jim attempts to throw him a party, but things quickly get out of hand. Tensions arise when Jim shows up at Charles' birthday dinner and meets his judgmental family.

episodes.name: Knuckleball
episodes.overview: Jim and Uribe go on an epic bender. Charles discovers a sad truth about Brockmire. When announcing with Raj, Brockmire has a few too many drinks.

episodes.name: Retirement Ceremony
episodes.overview: Jim faces his dysfunctional family at his father's funeral, struggling to mend his broken relationship with his sister. Brockmire must make peace with someone from his past.

episodes.name: Make-up Game
episodes.overview: Jules visits Jim, who gives her a tour of New Orleans. They reconnect for an evening, but have trouble figuring out the new terms of their relationship.

episodes.name: Broadcasters Jinx
episodes.overview: Jim takes a new gig as an Atlanta major league announcer. Charles focuses on the new direction his career might take. Confronted with the truth about a legendary announcer, Jim attempts to do the right thing in the most Brockmire-way possible.

episodes.name: Caught in a Rundown
episodes.overview: After Jim ends up in the hospital, Charles has an intervention to stop Brockmire's destructive habits. In attendance are a rag-tag group of friends and enemies from Brockmire's past. Jim meets a dangerous new friend.

episodes.name: In the Cellar
episodes.overview: Jim goes on a bender with his new nihilistic friend, Elle, who pushes him towards a new level of destruction. Brockmire ends up in the hospital again and finally takes rehab seriously. Charles approaches Jim with a new opportunity.

2.name: Season 2
2.overview: Now in New Orleans, Jim strives to break back out of the minors and back into the major leagues while continuing his popular podcast, facing a whole new level of drunken debauchery that The Big Easy makes so easy.

episodes.name: Clubhouse Cancer
episodes.overview: As Brockmire deals with his newfound sobriety, he is introduced as the new announcer for the Oakland Athletics with his co-announcer and former softball star Gabby Taylor.

episodes.name: Player To Be Named Later
episodes.overview: Brockmire struggles to accept that Jules is dating his good friend. In hopes of showing Jules the “new Jim” Brockmire begrudgingly agrees to put in a good word for Jules' boyfriend for a job at MLB Network.

episodes.name: The Yips
episodes.overview: While dealing with a case of “the yips”-a broadcaster's anxiety that makes it hard to remember the count-Brockmire faces threats from his predecessor, Matt “The Bat” Hardesty. Brockmire prays to God for the first time.

episodes.name: Banned for Life
episodes.overview: Brockmire's mother, who abandoned him and his sister at a young age, comes to town. She challenges Brockmire's relationship with his sister and threatens Brockmire.

episodes.name: Clubhouse Chemistry
episodes.overview: Brockmire urges Charles to leave a toxic relationship. Charles is appalled at Gus' terrible producing skills. Brockmire is infatuated with Matt Hardesty's nurse and tries to make amends with Hardesty.

episodes.name: Placed on Waivers
episodes.overview: After Gabby finds out that she is pregnant and then walks in on her wife cheating on her, Brockmire goes out of his way to be a good friend and to comfort her. She and Brockmire share their experiences of being cheated on while calling the game.

episodes.name: Disabled List
episodes.overview: Brockmire deals with sobriety-induced impotence and Matt's declining health. Brockmire's sponsor reminds him that he needs to find a higher power if he wants the AA program to rid him of his anxiety.

episodes.name: Opening Day
episodes.overview: As Brockmire and Gabby finally get a chance to call their first regular season MLB game for Oakland, they are confronted with unexpected protestors who are disciples of bigot Art Newlie.

3.name: Season 3
3.overview: Season three takes place three months after his stint in rehab, with Brockmire doing play-by-play in the radio booth for the major leagues in central Florida during spring training while maintaining his brazen and narcissistic tendencies, despite actually being on the wagon. When an opportunity arises for Jim and his new co-host Gabby to take over as lead broadcasters in Oakland, he must fight to change his ever-present amorality.

episodes.name: Favorable Matchup
episodes.overview: The year is 2030 and the world is in chaos, but at least Jim is broadcasting his favorite sport and has the love of his daughter. He then learns baseball is worse off than he thought and his daughter is moving to New York for college.

episodes.name: Three Year Contract
episodes.overview: Jim is trying hard to enact change in the league but the owners don't seem to care. At the same time, Jim's relationship with his daughter is getting worse, with visits becoming less frequent as she continues to pull away.

episodes.name: Low and Away
episodes.overview: Baseball is barely holding on so Jim turns to the one person he knows can turn it around, Jules James. However, it's going to take a lot of convincing to get her to leave Morristown to help a sport and man who both turned their backs on her.

episodes.name: Comeback Player of the Year
episodes.overview: Jim and Jules agree to keep their relationship professional, but when they team up to trick the owners into selling the teams to new owners who will let them make the changes they want, their antics remind them of the relationship they used to have.

episodes.name: Double Header
episodes.overview: Jules tries to win Beth's approval of the relationship she and Brockmire are trying to rekindle, but they don't get along until Jules takes Beth under her wing as a drinking buddy. Jim is irate that Jules was a bad influence on his daughter.

episodes.name: The Hall
episodes.overview: As Beth was growing up, Jim told her everything he knew about her deceased birth mother, but she finds out that he lied to her. On the biggest day of Jim's life, Beth is supposed to give a speech to memorialize him.

episodes.name: Union Negotiations
episodes.overview: Baseball players' union contracts are up for re-negotiation and a potential strike threatens the future of baseball altogether. Jim and Jules give it one last go and try to negotiate the terms of their potential relationship.

episodes.name: The Long Offseason
episodes.overview: Artificial intelligence threatens to take steps in its pursuit to rule the world and attempts to take over baseball. Jim and Jules must decide if they want to embolden this emerging society ruled by machines or stay with the failing status quo.

4.name: Season 4
4.overview: The fourth and final season jumps ahead to a dystopian, climate-changed 2030 when Jim Brockmire — clean-and-sober but still eloquently nasty — is named commissioner of baseball.
